inn1.comm: short outside off, moving away, Karthik leaves it be
away movement again, but not close enough to him to make him play
that's a beaut, just back of a length, just outside off, bounces and moves away, beating the hanging bat there
ODI run No. 1000 for Karthik, gets squared up by a length ball moving away, the thick edge goes along the ground to third man
dead middle of the bat as Sehwag goes forward-defensive. That tuk sound of the bat was loud, sweet and clear
another beaut from Malinga, superb start. Same length, same line, but there is away movement, and beats Sehwag's defensive stroke
Karthik walks down the pitch to push this to between point and cover-point. Kapugedara dives right into Randiv's boot as both converge on the ball and neither gets a hand to it
gets an inside edge, big swing there, but gets a single to square leg
nicely clipped away with the swing, past short midwicket
straighter one, but too wide outside off, and left alone
length ball outside off, and boom he drives, but straight to mid-off. It went straight to Mathews there, but took some stopping
wide outside off again, and left alone
legcutter, lovely legcutter, beats Karthik who is charging down the pitch
quicker, straighter, closer t off, and takes a thick edge, and so fast is it that it almost carries to backward point
gets the middle of the bat on this one, defending off the front foot
well bowled and well played, tries to test him on middle and leg after having him fend outside off for lone, and Karthik gets the bat down in time, clipping it into the leg side
nicely driven on the up, wide of mid-off, but Mathews makes a good save there, and also throws while on his knees to make Sehwag rush back
slower ball, around off, defended. Good testing over, Karthik survives
driven nicely through the covers. in the slot really, length ball, outside off, not much pace, and Sehwag drives with an open face
slightly shorter, and Sehwag rocks back to steer it to third man
left alone outside off, Sanga has to get up tall to make this collection, around the chest area
straighter one, draws Karthik into the shot, who plays for inswing, and is beaten. Sanga whips the bails off, but DK is in
and again, Karthik is drawn forward, looking to defend an inswinger, and this one goes straight again. Good plan from Kula and Sanga
this one does come in, and DK covers the line, and then guides it towards third man
beautiful stop by Randiv at cover-point, full-length dive to his left, saves four runs
there comes the bouncer, wonder what it took so long, DK sways out of the line
slower ball then, 113.6ks, flicked to mid-on, didn't seem too surprised by that
another slower ball, 118ks, there is an lbw appeal, but the inside edge saves him. He gets a run too
he has threaded this tight off-side field. There is a point, cover point, and short point between them, but he has punched this between Kapu and Dilshan, point and short point
slower ball, seems like he read it, and swiped at it, but still he was a touch early into it, getting a thick inside edge to fine leg, all along the ground
inside half of the bat, towards midwicket

big shout for lbw and given by Kumar Dharmasena! It's a huge inswinger from outside off, and although it has caught Sehwag on the back foot, it seems to be sliding down the leg side. Dharmasena takes his time and raises the finger. Sehwag is not happy, but the tracker serive shows the ball would have kissed the outside of the leg stump
and steers the first ball he plays past point
defended to cover
short, guided to third man
another big inswinger, this time it is too high, and hence no appeal. Gets a leg-bye to third man
outswinger outside off, Rohit pushes forward and leaves this alone
plays at this away from the body, but keeps it down, towards point
quick outswinger at 141ks, moving away from just outside off, draws Sharma into the shot and beats him
this one moves in, and Sharma is equal to it, dropping it wide of midwicket for a single
shortish outside off, Karthik gets behind it and defends
this outswinger is too wide outside off
close to off, DK presses forward and defends
inswinger around off, defended back to Kula
straighter one outside off, and left alone
big inswinger again, going down the leg side, Sharma fails to make contact, gets a leg-bye

Kula strikes again. Good planning, good catch, or is it a catch? Sanga has been standing up to stop Karthik from walking down and negating the swing. And after pinning him in the crease, Kula has been slipping in the straighter ones to beat him outside off. This time it is very close to off, and Sanga and Kula go for a big shout right away. There is no sound as the ball passes the bat, though. Nothing on the snicko either
inswinger, leaving him, left alone
closer to him but still just outside off, and left alone again
Sharma is trying to leave this one, but the ball hits the bat and rolls towards second slip
closer to off, defended back to the bowler
pushed back to the bowler
short outside off, and left alone
leading edge for four! Turns his wrists way outside off, away from his body, but it flies off the leading edge, between cover point and cover
this tie defends it with an open face, towards cover-point
nicely played, a clip/glance off the pads, deliberately plays it fine, fine of fine leg
extravagant swing outside off, left alone
left alone outside off again
what a beauty from Yuvraj, leaning into the line of the ball, and driving with an open face, between mid-off and extra cover. So good to watch
gets an outside edge, but it is played with soft hand, and goes along the ground to wide slip
Yuvraj defends off the back foot, makes a start for a single but is rightly sent back
holding its line outside off, and holding up a bit, hit back to the bowler

gentle half-volley ooutside off, and Sharma lofts it over covers. Was looking to go over extra cover, but ended up playing over pointish region. good thing was, he was always looking to go over the infield else could have been caught
leaves this one outside off
slightly slower, moving away, Sharma plays way away from the body, gets a thick edge for one. Mike Haysman says on Ten Sports: "Non-striker's end is the best spot for Sharma at the moment."
tries the short one, but slips it down the leg side
slightly squared up as he defends it around off
nicely bowled, nicely played, rolls his wrists over it to bring this back into Yuvraj who clips it to fine leg for one
stops at him a touch, but he keeps it down
around off, moving away, right behind it
beautiful off-drive. Again leans in, and punches it between the bowler and mid-off. Almost a check shot, but what timing
left alone outside off
short, moving away wide outside off, and Sanga does well to collect it. Remember he is standing up
starts off and moves away and left alone
this time Sanga doesn't make a clean collection as Yuvraj leaves this alone too. There has been big inswing for Kula and Sanga until now has done a good job standing up to the stumps
away movement outside off, Sharma lets this one be

this is so plumb Mathews doesn't even appeal! Outswinger followed by inswinger, and gone! Simple as that. This time he plays around it without any feet movement, and it hits him in front of middle. Mathews knows he is gone and turns around to appeal only after he has crossed the batsman. Don't see anything wrong with it - it was so straight. Sharma again doesn't look happy and slowly trudges off, that's becoming a bit of a habit for him. Needs to watch it - last time he got away perhaps because Randiv's act hogged the headlines. Sharma's reaction then was clear dissent, and not the first instance in his career either
driven in front of his body, towards mid-off
on the pads, turned away to square leg
pushed back to the bowler
around off, played to cover, along the ground
full outside off, defended towards cover
comes forward and defends another delivery
short of a length, outside off, punched away to point
slower ball, pushed to cover
pitches leg and middle, moving to outside off, and Yuvi defends it
left alone outside off, gets a big stride in before shouldering arms
defends a length ball outside off - a wicket and no runs off the last 15 deliveries
oh what a shot, beautiful cover-drive on a knee. Slower ball, gets on a knee, and caresses it through the covers, between short cover and extra cover
left alone outside off
looks to turn this around the corner, but plays it towards square leg
shorter, and guides this between square leg and mid-on
on the pads, looks to work it away but doesn't make good connection
hets this to straighten up outside off, Yuvraj leaves it alone
short, into the body, clipped to midwicket
goes really wide, slightly slower, around off, defended back
kicks up outside off, left alone, Sanga makes a nice collection
back of a length, into the body, worked away for one
worked away off the pads for one
on the pads again and turned away fine for one
on the pads, but moving in, and Yuvraj does well to keep it down, towards midwicket
full on the pads, flicked away fine, nice glance

huge shout, but not given!. Sangakkara, Dilshan, Jayawardene and Mathews can't believe it. It's a long, long appeal. Russel Arnold calls it "very similar to the Hakka". But facts first, slightly slower ball outside off, Raina hangs his bat out, and there is a sound and slight deviation - ever so slight - as it passes his bat. So Raina perhaps lucky to get away with it. Umpire Rauf is unmoved despite that appeal
defended to cover
fuller, pushed wide of extra cover for one
back of a length, pushed to cover

and Raina is gone! Pretty similar to the one where he was not given! Perera strikes second ball. Seems like Dharmasena has made up for Rauf's mistake. Back of a length, outside off, stays low, beats Raina, snicko shows nothing, Raina is not convinced. Sri Lanka will take it - they had him in the last over
short outside off and left alone
sweetly punched away, one bounce to short extra cover
and again, one bounce to short extra cover
short, and powerfully cut away, backward point gets a hand to it, and Mathews keeps them to two
back of a length, around off, pushed back to the bowler
inside edge towards square leg
holds up a bit, Yuvraj stays back and keeps it down
moving into him, played straight to square leg. Rightly sent back by Dhoni
length ball, crunched back to Mathews
length ball outside off, pushed to mid-off
edged for four! the slip is there but it is far too wide, ad this is a regulation edge off a back-of-a-length delivery just outside off. Sip moves straighter, but the horse is gone
beats him outside off this time, just holding its line a touch
moving slightly in, left alone outside off
again back of a length, just outside off, shoulders arms again

the edge of Dhoni's bat is playing around with the lone slip! At the start of the over, he edges one to first slip, making the wide slip move finer. Now he edges it to where third slip would have been. Educated edges, if ever there were two
left alone outside off
back of a length, outside off, defended to cover
fuller, straighter, looking to flick it, but ends up playing it to mid-off
shorter again, punched to point
presses forward to defend again
moves in off a shortish length, and played back to the bowler
back of a length, around off, dead-batted again. Back-to-back maidens for Mathews
left alone outside off
full outside off, driven straight to mid-off
back of a length, outside off, left alone again
punched down the ground, straight to mid-off
makes that 12 dots, driven nicely, but straight to short extra cover, on the bounce

no need for an umpire here! not the smartest shot Dhoni has played either. Sanga goes back to standing back, and immediately Dhoni goes for a walk down the pitch, and looks to turn this to leg from way outside off. the ball holds its line enough to get the edge, and Sanga holds it safely. Dhoni walks
defended back to the bowler
played off the hips, gets a single to midwicket - first run in 15 deliveries
defended with an open face
beats him outside off with the slight away movement
left alone outside off this time
left alone outside off again
what a beaut! pitches leg and middle, offcuts to beat him just outside off
full outside off, doesn't make good connection
back of a length, squeezed to sweeper-cover for one
short, around off, rides the bounce and defends it to point
full and wide, shoulders arms
length ball, defended to extra cover
left alone outside off, and Sanga makes a good take again
shoulders arms again
closer to the stumps, defended towards cover
back of a length, on the pads, flicked but not in the gap
between keeper and wide slip! Rauf calls it runs, Sanga thinks it is byes. technically it will count as a drop
back of a length, punched to cover
defended off the front foot
nine-ball duck for Jadeja! Squared up as he looks to turn this to leg from around off, and the leading edge settles safely with gully

and PK is gone first ball! Caught at mid-off! Perera on a hat-trick. PK looks at the pitch, then the bat. It was an extravagant drive on a back-of-a-length ball outside off. Nowhere near it. Ordinary shot, good, old tailender shot
and Nerha keeps it out, defending it with a straight bal
makes room and squeezes this past cover, will come back for two
holds up a bit, bounces a touch extra, but it is wide enough for him to leave it alone
full toss, crashed away, and what a fantastic, full-length dive by Dilshan at cover. Saves three runs

and he is gone! good bouncer, and he gloves it through to Sanga. SL on fire here. too good for the tailender, Nehra fends at it, and it goes off the left glove. And needless to say, Sanga is standing back for Malinga
defends a shortish delivery
left alone outside off
legcutter outside off, Ishant nowhere near it as he defends
defended outside off, keeps it down
single off the first ball again! In the last over, Nehra fell t the second ball after the single first ball
length ball, driven to extra cover, confident-looking shot
falls short of second slip, slightly slower ball, Ishant ends up playing in front of his body, but the edge doesn't carry
cut away outside off, misfielded at point
length ball around off, pushed to cover
left alone outside off
full ball, nicely driven, straight to mid-off
goes for the wide yorker, but bowls it to wide
full and wide, driven hard to third man, the fielder fumbles, they look for two but go back. Sanga goes for the blind flick to outsmart Ishant, but misses, and they squeeze in the overthrow
short ball, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
left alone outside off again - unlike PK, Ishant is making the bowlers earn his wicket
stays a touch low, in front of stumps too, blocked back to the bowler
short, into the ribs, and Ishant gets a soft leading edge as he looks to turn it around the corner. It lands just short of Malinga
shot! Length ball, clears the front leg, and lofts it over mid-on
oh what a beautiful shot! Yuvraj makes room and chips this length ball over wide mid-off. And look at the timing, it sails for six. And this is no Mickey-Mouse ground
drilled away into the leg side, gets a single to deep midwicket
moves away from outside off, too far wide
left alone outside off
full toss outside off, guided to third man - and Yuvraj denies the single that could have brought up India's 100. Yuvraj now wants to take Malinga's over
and suddenly Ishant has a brain freeze and swings at a wide delivery outside off. No contact made
looks for the old-fashioned slog to a full ball, gets an inside edge towards square leg

Premeditated shot. Camps on the back foot, looking to hit this - a full ball - over square-leg-midwicket region, and is hit on the back leg. Given out, but missing off clearly. It is umpire Rauf this time
full outside off, looks to defend and is beaten
pokes again, and gets a thick edge towards third man to bring up India's hundred
slower ball outside off, looks to drive, and is beaten
yorker, keeps it out
left alone outside off
inswinger, edged away, falls short of slip, gets a single off the ricochet
full and straight, plays with an open face, towards cover
bouncer, looks to pull, and is beaten
makes room and squeezes this through point for two
yorker around leg, keeps it out
digs out a yorker
bouncer, sharp, gets him in the glove, but somehow it falls back on the pitch. Fierce look too Malinga gives him
short again, not that high, Ojha backs away and keeps it down
again rib high, again he keeps it down towards gully
vicious slower offcutter, beats him comprehensively. Sanga and Mahela go for a long long appeal. There is daylight between bat and ball
yorker around, digs it out, Kapu throws down the stumps at the non-striker's end, and Ishant has made it back by half a frame. He was plonking the bat back in, as opposed to sliding it back
yorker, beats him, and it is just outside off. Almost a wicket
length ball wide outside off, asking the No. 10 to drive. Sharma lets it be
nicely driven, good-looking shot, but Dilshan makes a diving save in the covers

what a beaut to finish the five-for! slightly back of a length, around off, Ishant plays for the angle, the ball holds its line to take the off stump. Perera is pleased as punch, and why shouldn't he be?

inn2.comm: outswinger, but too wide to interest Mahela
left alone outside off again
short and wide, cut away square. Easy boundary
length ball around off, stays back and plays it back to the bowler
again around off, straightening a bit, defended
Ishant is late to move at third man, Mahela was going for the big hit over covers, got a big edge towards Ishant but he reacted late
angled across him, and he shoulders arms
swinging in, turned away to fine leg for one
full and wide, and Dilshan slashes at it, missing it
superb shot! Not too short, but he crunches this between point and third man. Lovely timing
full, driven to cover
looks to pull, but gets an underside edge towards mid-on
indipper this time, Mahela is hurried into keeping this out - expecting outswingers
inswinger again, this time he clips it away into the leg side
legcutter this time, but Mahela has got himself outside the line of off by walking down and across
away movement again, defended into the off side
leaves this outswinger alone
inswinger, swinging too far down, and he has glanced it fine. They are getting to the target fast
swiped away with the swing, clears the front leg and hits him past short midwicket - uppishly, but into the gap
slightly wide, he cuts, but doesn't make a sweet connection, ends up playing it to point
Dilshan is a man in hurry! We have to break for supper in 19 minutes. Can we finish it off before that? Short ball, and he rocks back and pulls it over midwicket. One bounce for four
short again, but no room to swing the arms, and he plays this to midwicket
slower ball, on the pads, and he steals a leg-bye
steered fine of third man, but they keep them down to one
around off, back of a length, pushed to cover
shot! picks the length ball and swings it over mid-on
slower ball, looking to leave it, but it goes off the toe of the bat to third man
outswinger, hit down to mid-on
back of a length, punched to cover
wide down the leg side
short, into the leg side, pulled past short fine, SL cantering home
into the ribs, hit back to the bowler
cut away to third man for one
punched away through covers for four. Superb timing and placement through extra cover
and again - no room whatsoever but he has forced it through extra cover again. A diving Ojha gets a hand to it, and saves one run
misfield by Jadeja at square leg, but they were taking the single anyway
tries the bouncer, but slips it down the leg side

helmet-byes! Dilshan looks to pull, but bails out, and is hit flush in the helmet. Hit so hard that it flies for four leg-byes. Dilshan and Nehra have a nice laugh about it. They are good friends, having been Delhi Daredevils team-mates
good legcutter around off, beats him
pushed away to cover
makes room to try and hit through covers, but ends up playing straight to the fielder
short ball, down the leg side, not called wide, because it slipped down after crossing the stumps
another short ball, and again massive posthumous swing - away from the batsman this time. Dhoni makes a one-handed take
slower short one, Mahela looks to pull, then looks to uppercut, doesn't make any connection
swinging into the pad, Dilshan misses out on leg-side runs
short, into the body, gets a leg-bye off the midsection
wide down the leg side
and wide down the leg side again. India are keen to end this soon as well
no-ball now! But this is a superb delivery, nipping in sharply from outside off, hitting him in the pad. Leg-bye conceded
crash! clears the front leg and punches this through point. Slightly back of a length, enough for him to play the shot
looks for the same shot, but this one nips back in, giving him no room
smashed away for four more! Short into the body, and he swivels and pulls this mercilessly to square-leg fence
flicked to short midwicket
and what a beautiful shot to start, leaning in, right on the top of it, and driving it through extra cover
bouncer, pulled away over midwicket for four, early night tonight
hit back to PK who gives Mahela a stare. Not required
short again, and pulled to fine leg for four, fine of the long leg. Well done Mahela
length ball outside off, punched to mid-off
and he is welcome to the crease with a crunchy shot from Dilshan, through covers for four
Dilshan goes! He was in too much of a hurry to finish this asap. Looks to loft it straight down the ground, but it is not full enough and he ends up skying it to mid-off
Sharma on a hat-trick! Short ball, and pulled straight to midwicket. Sri Lankans want an early finish, but these wickets are delaying proceedings
back of a length, Sanga gets back it to prevent what would have been the most incredible hat-trick ever - in terms of having zero effect on the way the match is headed
left alone outside off
and again he shoulders arms
left alone outside off
defended to cover
inswinger, which means it is leaving Tharanga, and he steers it
shoulders arms again
punched away square of third man, comes back for two
punched away again, but this time straight to backward point
wide outside off, no need to play at it
nicely bowled, pitched middle and leg, seaming away, beating him
defended solidly this time
soft hands as he edges this one past third slip
punched away on the up, wide of mid-off, but can't squeeze it through
wide and wide and driven over point in the extravagant Sanga style. Top shot
back of a length, hit to cover
check-drive, deliberately in the air, effective because he is looking to play straight. Up and over mid-off
hit to cover
another beautiful check-drive. Again he deliberately goes in the air. Again he looks to go straight, up and over mid-on
short ball, ducks under it
another short ball, and he ducks under it
left alone outside off
looks to crash this through the off side, but ends up hitting it back to the bowler
punched to wide of mid-off, DK makes a diving save, Sanga sent back
pushed down the ground, between the bowler and the mid-off - one of three they took is called short
this one bounces at him, but it is wide enough to not take the edge
full ball, takes a single to mid-on
short ball, into the ribs, ducks under it
full, swinging away, beating him around off
another short one, and he ducks under it
moves across to defend this length delivery moving away from him
guides this between backward point and cover-point for two runs
and it's all over, Sangakkara finishes it with a lovely punch through the covers, and SL charge into the finals with a thumping win
